intro: Eumachia rotundifolia, commonly known as the round-leaf eumachia, is a species of flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Onagraceae, which includes willows and evening primroses. The plant is characterized by its round, fleshy leaves and clusters of small, pinkish-white flowers. It typically grows in wetlands and marshy areas, thriving in moist, acidic soils. Eumachia rotundifolia is often found in swamp forests and is an important component of wetland ecosystems.
